title: ./gradlew build fails
body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging docs: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Monitor/Logging/ -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3Ahyperledger/Besu -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
As an advanced user, I want to build Besu from source. 

### Acceptance Criteria
* Besu builds correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Follow the [Hyperledger wiki's](https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/BESU/Building+from+source) quickstart: `./gradlew build`

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Besu builds.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Build fails.
```
$ ./gradlew build

> Task :datatypes:compileJava
Note: /Users/mija/programming/ConsenSys/besu/datatypes/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/datatypes/Wei.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.

> Task :ethereum:core:compileJava
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
```

The wiki says "Java 11+" so I just used what I had (18).

 - `./gradlew build` still fails with 11, though differently.

Docs are wrong.  It's not automatically tested so this isn't suprising. It runs on 11+ but doesn't build on 11+

 It doesn't build on 17 either because of a change in one of the JDK error messages.  So an open ended build will never work because of the things the JDK likes to change.  Open eneded execution... that works and the JDK does have a commitment for that.

Fix is to update the docs.

The `EnodeURLImplTest` test failure should be opened up as a separate focused issue.  Other tests relating to DNS have provem brittle, so it may depend on some of the unique setup of your box.

Since it's still failing for Java 11...this is likely a mac-specific issue in the way it constructs the hostname. Maybe we could add a special case for mac OS in EnodeURLImplTest. I think something similar has been done before.

It's not mac specific.  The library changed the text of the error message and the unit tests check for a specific error message not just an exception type.

https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/3953/files#diff-971ce2f56b9dde5397e2e45beba8da49366dc9eb49e214bae6f9bbc8b46614c2R193

Not sure if we're talking about the same test.

When I run `EnodeURLImplTest` on my mac, `toURI_WithHostnameShouldWorkWhenDnsEnabledAndUpdateEnabled` fails with an unexpected exception rather than an assertion failure.

```
Invalid enode URL syntax 'enode://6f8a80d14311c39f35f516fa664deaaaa13e85b2f7493f37f6144d86991ec012937307647bd3b9a82abe2974e1407241d54947bbb39763a4cac9f77166ad92a0@sdudley+mbp:30303'. Enode URL should have the following format 'enode://<node_id>@<ip>:<listening_port>[?discport=<discovery_port>]'. Missing or invalid host or ip address.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid enode URL syntax 'enode://6f8a80d14311c39f35f516fa664deaaaa13e85b2f7493f37f6144d86991ec012937307647bd3b9a82abe2974e1407241d54947bbb39763a4cac9f77166ad92a0@sdudley+mbp:30303'. Enode URL should have the following format 'enode://<node_id>@<ip>:<listening_port>[?discport=<discovery_port>]'. Missing or invalid host or ip address.
	at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.p2p.peers.EnodeURLImpl.fromString(EnodeURLImpl.java:90)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.p2p.peers.EnodeURLImplTest.toURI_WithHostnameShouldWorkWhenDnsEnabledAndUpdateEnabled(EnodeURLImplTest.java:506)
```

That one is not mac specific, it's local config specific.  Your hostname has a `+` in it (`sdudley+mbp`), which per RFC-2396 is a reserved character in URIs. 

Per section 3.2.2 there is no escapable format for a hostname with a `+` in it, as it is an invalid character in a hostname.
```
      host          = hostname | IPv4address
      hostname      = *( domainlabel "." ) toplabel [ "." ]
      domainlabel   = alphanum | alphanum *( alphanum | "-" ) alphanum
      toplabel      = alpha | alpha *( alphanum | "-" ) alphanum
```

@shemnon Thanks, you're right, it's my local config. I mistakenly thought the Mac default settings resulted in a '+' but looks like something has changed my local settings. Removing the plus from the computer name resolves this error.

@hmijail I'm closing this issue as ./gradlew build works for me, and I suspect it will work for you if your hostname only contains legal characters. Feel free to reopen if that's not the case.
Updated https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/BESU/Building+from+source to say "Java 11" instead of "Java 11+" in the building prerequisites
